text:
a) where I can put property/configuration/xml files for helper classes that are 
packed as jars. Since these configuration files are meant to be edited by the 
deployer on his/her tomcat instance, I cannot afford to put them in the jar of 
my application, though I can pack a template of them in the war file. For 
example let us say I have a DBConnectionPool class packed as a jar which has a 
property file which give the options of Driver/user/password that is supposed 
to be edited by the user using my war file. Since the lib directory in WEB-INF 
takes only jar files and puts them in the CLASSPATH, I am now forced to create 
a jar file of the property file. Also the user of my war file will have to 
unjar the jar to edit the property file and pack it back as a jar.
b) The lib directory of WEB-INF understands only files which have a jar 
extension. It could not understand the JDBC driver file from 
oracle 'classes12.zip' , even though it is a jar file with a different 
extension.
creator: vivek.vasudeva@bankofamerica.com

text:
a) You can use the 'classes' folder to do that. Put the properties there, so 
that you can edit them easily.
b) Won't fix, as the spec mandates using JARs. Using a zip would break 
portability.
